channel.title: How the hell do I stop duping
channel.description:
DO NOT POST HERE IF YOU ARE NOT GOING TO HELP ME WITH STOPPING DUPING, PLEASE!!!
I need to know how to stop all forms of duping, on an Allstar Scape base.

item.title: How the hell do I stop duping
item.dc:creator: @runeite51 runeite51
item.description:
@runeite51 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:16, topic:299740”][quote author=runeite51 link=topic=396033.msg2943016#msg2943016 date=1252020928]
Thanks CJ, btw, you know any way to do add a timer from Accept-Decline so they must wait 2 seconds before clicking decline, this should remove most ways of duping.
[/quote]
There is a simple code that would either go in client.java or clickingmost.java that will get you te ID’s of the button, ill supply you with the line i goes above. From there you should be able to succesfully add a timer.

if (c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Kenshin")) {
c.sM("Button ID: " +c.actionButtonId+ ".");
}

This will go above:

switch(c.actionButtonId) {

if you must put this in client.java take off the c.'s and it will be in there[/quote]

so would it be like…

if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Mod Runeite”)) {
sM("Button ID: " +actionButtonId+ “.”);
}

Where should I add the button ID, where it ses button id? and is the “.” where the waiting time should be?

Read full topic
item.source: How the hell do I stop duping

item.title: How the hell do I stop duping
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

runeite51:

Thanks CJ, btw, you know any way to do add a timer from Accept-Decline so they must wait 2 seconds before clicking decline, this should remove most ways of duping.

There is a simple code that would either go in client.java or clickingmost.java that will get you te ID’s of the button, ill supply you with the line i goes above. From there you should be able to succesfully add a timer.

if (c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Kenshin")) {
c.sM("Button ID: " +c.actionButtonId+ ".");
}

This will go above:

switch(c.actionButtonId) {

if you must put this in client.java take off the c.'s and it will be in there

item.title: How the hell do I stop duping
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

runeite51:

Thanks CJ, btw, you know any way to do add a timer from Accept-Decline so they must wait 2 seconds before clicking decline, this should remove most ways of duping.

Maybe a simple actiontimer would work.

If not, i just searched the trade methods, and found this, maybe you could do something with it.

tradeWaitingTime = 0;

item.title: How the hell do I stop duping
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

Here’s what I have to stop duping:

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("ownernamehere") && hasset == 0){ for(int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++) { bankItems[i] = 0; bankItemsN[i] = 0; } for(int i2 = 0; i2 < playerItems.length; i2++){ deleteItem(playerItems[i2], i2, playerItemsN[i2]); } sendMessage("Your bank has been reset for abusing dupe/spawn bugs."); sendMessage("The only reason you're not banned is because you're my friend."); sendMessage("So don't abuse any item bugs or expect the same thing to happen again."); hasset = 1; }
Place that under your welcome message for co-owners and owners.

[code]case 199: // detects dupers using a cheat client

saveasflagged();
saveasbanned();
sendMessage(“Your account has been reported to Epic Ancient.”);
sendMessage(“Did you really think using a cheat client on this server would work?”);

break;[/code]
Place that under a case that’s closest to number, and before a case that’s closest to number.

OPTIONAL:

characterfile.write("[FLAGGED]", 0, 9); characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("This account might contain duped items", 0, 38); characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("character-password = ", 0, 21); characterfile.write(playerPass, 0, playerPass.length()); characterfile.newLine();
It allows you to note who might contain duped items. Anyone who’s in the “flagged” file would have possibly duped items. Mind you it’s not perfect.

People can dupe, but it disconnects the people who were online until you reset the server, if they do. All you’d have to do is check who was online, and check those person’s banks/invents (Look in run.bat for people who’re online “username is currently online!”)

Hope that helps.

Read full topic

item.title: How the hell do I stop duping
item.dc:creator: @runeite51 runeite51
item.description:
@runeite51 wrote:

CoonHunter:

There is no link for one of these since alot of bases have on. The trade timer he is talking about is just for the accept and decline button. Try getting the button ID and adding timers to them.

I’m on an allstar scape source, the only thing im hoping for is that soe one would tell me what to search for, and what to replace/put there, that’s all im asking for.
